content.full_text: John T. Stuart and Abraham Lincoln to Levi Davis, 15 March 18381
paragraphs: John T. Stuart and Abraham Lincoln to Levi Davis, 15 March 18381

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the letter in its entirety including the signatures and the
                  address on the back side.
2Davis’s letter of March 2 has not been located.

3Upon Stapp’s death, theDecatur Republicanrefers to him as “Dr. Stapp,” so it is probable that he is the Stapp to which Stuart
                  and Lincoln are referring.Decatur Republican(Decatur, IL), 2 January 1883, 3:4.

4Unknown v. Stapp,  Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=141095.
